attributes.action: STOP CHARGING IMMIGRATION HEALTH SURCHARGE FROM OVERSEAS NURSES & DEPENDENTS
attributes.additional_details: Ironically even-if a nurse work for NHS,  her family of 4 who apply for visa in the UK will be forced to pay £2200 a year to get access to NHS  treatments. A nurse,work full-time in NHS only earn 19000 after  pension,tax and NI contribution which is only around half of earning of a average full time worker who earn £36611 per year in UK in 2019. The hike in health surcharge will make nurses to pay around 12% of very low national average salary, makes nurses extremely difficult to survive in UK.
attributes.background: Immigration health surcharge (IHS) £200 introduced in 2015 to restrict  tourists accessing the NHS. But now govt  has tripled it within last 14 months, considering it as a alternative source of revenue. From Oct 2020 have to pay £624 for an adult and £470 for a child every year as IHS to access NHS.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/301948.

You can find out more here: www.gov.uk/coronavirus 

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/ 

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips
